raw_data.title: Cybersecurity Analyst I (CAI)
raw_data.description: Job Description: Provide cybersecurity-focused program support for Incident Response Management services for Federal and DoD customer networks.   Incident Response services help organizations impacted by a Cybersecurity compromise to determine the extent of the incident, remove the adversary from their systems, and restore their networks to a more secure state.  Functional Responsibilities: • Provides technical expertise for the identification, development and prioritization of cyberspace operations requirements, processes, procedures, and governing directives • Assists in conducting cyberspace operations and defense of the client networks  • Provides situational awareness (SA) of cyber incidents, health, performance, availability, and reliability of the network • Identifies issues and priorities affecting operations • Supports the creation, dissemination, and compliance of applicable orders and directives to the client community and stakeholders • Addresses areas of concern for the development of cyberspace capabilities for cyberspace operations • Prepares and modifies requirements to develop cyberspace capabilities based on the changing cyberspace environment for appropriate Government review, validation, and prioritization • Analyzes capability development requirements, concept of operation documents, and system architectures

labor_categories.labor_category: Cybersecurity Risk and Vulnerability Analyst II (CRVAII)

raw_data.title: Cybersecurity Risk and Vulnerability Analyst II (CRVAII)
raw_data.description: Job Description: Provide cybersecurity-focused program support for Risk and Vulnerability Assessments (RVA) Management for Federal and DoD customer networks.  Risk and Vulnerability Assessments (RVA) conduct assessments of threats and vulnerabilities, determines deviations from acceptable configurations, enterprise, or local policy, assesses the level of risk, and develops and/or recommends appropriate mitigation countermeasures in operational and non-operational situations. RVA services include: Network Mapping, Vulnerability Scanning, Phishing Assessment, Wireless Assessment, Web Application Assessment, Operating System Security Assessment (OSSA), and Database Assessment.    Functional Responsibilities: • Ensures the rigorous application of cybersecurity policies, principles, and practices in the delivery of all Information Technology (IT) and cybersecurity services • Develops and designs security solutions to maintain confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information throughout the enterprise • Identifies, plans, and documents improvements to security controls currently in place • Develops and documents recommendations and courses of action (COAs) to solve complex cybersecurity problems • Develops and interprets cybersecurity requirements as part of the IT acquisition development process and assists in the formulation of cybersecurity/IT budgets • Plans and schedules the installation of new or modified security hardware, operating systems, and software applications • Ensures the assessment and implementation of identified computer and network environment fixes such as system patches and fixes associated with specific technical vulnerabilities as part of the Cybersecurity Vulnerability Management program • Guides the implementation of appropriate operational structures and processes to ensure an effective cybersecurity program, including boundary defense, incident detection, and response

raw_data.title: Cyber Security Expert 3 (CSE3)
raw_data.description: Functional Responsibility: Senior Technical Staff level personnel with extensive experience and credentials in cyber security typically requiring a long-term strategic perspective. Exhibits an exceptional degree of knowledge specific to Cyber Security State of the Art. Advises and/or applies highly advanced technologies, scientific principles, theories, and concepts. Viewed as expert within the field. Develops information which extends knowledge in cyber security field. Information may form the basis of new concepts, strategies, theories, and products. Acts independently to uncover and resolve issues associated with the development and implementation of operational cyber security programs. Designs and oversees key analytic tasks and tests results involving complex data sets. Virtually self-supervisory. Security Clearance Required: Ability to obtain a security clearance.
raw_data.education_and_experience_substitution: Bachelors and 12 years, or High School and 16 years

labor_categories.years_experience: Bachelors and 12 years, or High School and 16 years

raw_data.title: Cybersecurity Threat Intelligence Analyst I (CTIAI)
raw_data.description: Job Description: Provide cybersecurity-focused program support for Incident Response Management or Cybersecurity Hunting services for Federal and DoD customer networks.   Incident Response services help organizations impacted by a Cybersecurity compromise to determine the extent of the incident, remove the adversary from their systems, and restore their networks to a more secure state.  Cyber Hunt activities are responses to crisis or urgent situations within the pertinent domain to mitigate immediate and potential threats. Cyber Hunt activities start with the premise that threat actors known to target some organizations in a specific industry, or specific systems, are likely to also target other organizations in the same industry or with the same systems. Use information and threat intelligence specifically focused on the proximate incident to identify undiscovered attacks. Investigates and analyzes all relevant response activities.  Functional Responsibilities: • Comprehend all aspects of Cybersecurity and apply expertise in technical Cyber threat intelligence to identify gaps in organizational communications, processes, and training quickly.  • Monitor open-source information feeds and threat actor activity to identify activity levels and indicators for Cyber threats and Cyber attacks. • Mine open data sources to identify potential Cyber threats, targets of interest, and timeframes for attacks. Analyze and research known indicators, correlate events, identify malicious activity, and discover new sources to provide early warnings for a variety of Cyber threats.  • Work closely with threat analysts, incident responders, and others to publish tactical, operational, and strategic client products and public blog posts.  • Research reports and work as part of a team to research Cyber attack and intrusion vectors, malware, and advanced adversaries.

raw_data.title: Functional Analyst (FA30)
raw_data.description: Functional Responsibility: Performs technical activities, which impact the proposal, system level design, detail design and manufacture of advanced electronics systems. Technical support may involve one or more of the following disciplines: component engineering, configuration management, failure analysis, human factors engineering, logistics, continuity of operations, outreach and awareness for information assurance programs, and/or certification, and accreditation activities.

raw_data.title: Senior Functional Analyst (FASr)
raw_data.description: Functional Responsibility: Performs technical activities, which impact the proposal, system level design, detail design and manufacture of advanced electronics systems. Technical support may involve one or more of the following disciplines: component engineering, configuration management, failure analysis, human factors engineering, logistics, continuity of operations, outreach and awareness for information assurance programs, certification and accreditation activities, and/or test engineering.

raw_data.title: Senior Information Engineer (IEP)
raw_data.description: Functional Responsibility: Plans, organizes, writes, edits and formats incident and reports and other related publications concerned with the description, assessment and impact of threats and intrusions. Experience with IT and cyber security policy including executive level directives and policy and law. Organizes basic source material including raw data, analyst commentary and other sources of intelligence. Prepares charts, graphs, two- and three-dimensional drawings from rough sketches, written or verbal directions. Familiar with illustration and desktop publishing software tools. May provide leadership, mentoring, and oversight to teams of less experienced staff. Security Clearance Required: Ability to obtain a security clearance.

raw_data.title: Information Technology Senior Consultant (ITSR)
raw_data.description: Functional Responsibility: Performs overall program development and management activities. Performs system analysis, design, development, test, and evaluation activities, ensures the integration of software, hardware, reliability, maintainability, safety, survivability, human and other requirements in the total engineering effort. Formulates operational concept, performs mission and functional analyses, conducts requirements and information analysis, cost-benefit analysis, system trade studies, and risk analysis. Selects system architecture, allocates requirements, and prepares specifications.

raw_data.title: IT Security Specialist (ITSS)
raw_data.description: Demonstrated proficiency in Information Technology, System and Network Administration. Functional Responsibility: Provides information system solutions and technical support in one or more areas including system implementation strategies, personal computer/client server support, systems programming, applications design and development, database design and administration, telecommunications and network support and administration. Supports information assurance activities across all areas of operations. Also supports certification and accreditation activities and system security review process.

raw_data.title: Senior IT Security Specialist (ITSS1)
raw_data.description: Functional Responsibility: Investigates, identifies, evaluates, and documents systems and applications. Performs all-source scientific and technical intelligence analysis to determine characteristics of various systems and functions of instrumentation. Reports changes, trends and implications regarding design and integration of evolving systems and instrumentation. Prepares briefings and reports of analysis methodology and results. Leads certification and accreditation activities for organizational system certification.

raw_data.title: Knowledge Management Specialist 1 (KMS1)
raw_data.description: Functional Responsibility: Plans, organizes, writes, edits and formats incident and threat reports and other related publications concerned with the description, assessment and impact of threats and intrusions. Familiarity with IT and cyber security policy.  Organizes basic source material including raw data, analyst commentary and other sources of intelligence. Plans, lays out, draws, and produces a variety of technical illustrations. Prepares charts, graphs, two- and three-dimensional drawings from rough sketches, written or verbal directions. Familiar with illustration and desktop publishing software tools. Security Clearance Required: Ability to obtain a security clearance.

raw_data.title: Procurement Analyst (PA)
raw_data.description: Functional Responsibility: Initiate, coordinate, develop and prepare policies, procedures, directives and plans to support acquisition functions. Assist with writing and revising documents as required.
